event.title: is located at 41°23′33″N 81°32′04″W. According to the 2010

data.event: Bedford is located at 41°23′33″N 81°32′04″W. According to the 2010 census, the city has a total area of 5.40 square miles (14.0 km2), of which 5.35 square miles (13.9 km2) (or 99.07%) is land and 0.05 square miles (0.13 km2) (or 0.93%) is water.

event.title: began as part of the Connecticut Western Reserve in 1797

data.event: Bedford began as part of the Connecticut Western Reserve in 1797 and was surveyed Seth Pease and Amzi Atwater, under the direction of Moses Cleaveland.

event.title: 1816, the Taylor Chair Company was created

data.event: In 1816, the Taylor Chair Company was created by Benjamin Franklin Fitch along the banks of Tinkers Creek.
The company is still in existence today and is considered to be the longest running, single family owned company in the US.
